author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: فَتَحْتَ بابَ السَّمآءِ بِمِفْتاحِ اسْمِكَ الأَقْدَسِ الأَعَزِّ الأَعْظَمِ الأَبْهى وَدَعَوْتَ الكُلَّ إِلى بَحْرِ اللِّقآءِ، فَلَمَّا ارْتَفَعَ نِدائُكَ الأَحْ
translation: Unto Thee be praise for that Thou hast enraptured me by the sweetness of Thine utterances, and set me towards the horizon above which the splendors of the Daystar of Thy face have shone, and caused me to turn unto Thee at a time when most of Thy creatures had broken off from Thee.
